__e: I thought about you, Paige, about life in general.
When my friend Paige came up to you at the bar, what did she say to you?
Did you tell her about Paige's dad coming to school?
I thought that Paige asked for some space.
Why-why is Paige giving you money?
- Paige, please, we-- But everything else is just a lie, right?
Paige, it's not that I don't trust you.
You can just yell at me. Or, you know, maybe I'll talk. Because, Paige, this really isn't your mom's fault, okay?
Paige, you can look different after you've done something like that.
Did Paige not tell you that I was crashing your TV night?
Yep, Paige said she trusts me and that I trust you.
And she spoke of you and Paige, wanted to send a message that she loved you.
Paige said if you give someone a rock from wherever you go that it's kinda like the person was there with you.
And tell me, Mrs. Paige, what do the neighbours think of all this?
And Paige, who happens to be my friend, was putting herself in harms' way to...
When you told Paige you'd rather be friends I didn't believe a word of it.
Now, Paige is your girlfriend, so you might want to move to two.
Paige is the smart one, she always works her ass off, and she does everything right. No.
